title: Getting Started with rTASSEL
text: Thanks checking rTASSEL! document, go functionalities used work TASSEL software via R. TASSEL software package used evaluate traits associations, evolutionary patterns, linkage disequilibrium. Strengths software include: opportunity number new powerful statistical approaches association mapping General Linear Model (GLM) Mixed Linear Model (MLM). MLM implementation technique lab’s published Nature Genetics paper - Unified Mixed-Model Method Association Mapping - reduces Type error association mapping complex pedigrees, families, founding effects population structure. ability handle wide range indels (insertion & deletions). software ignore type polymorphism; however, species (like maize), common type polymorphism. information can found following paper: Bradbury PJ, Zhang Z, Kroon DE, Casstevens TM, Ramdoss Y, Buckler ES. (2007) TASSEL: Software association mapping complex traits diverse samples. Bioinformatics 23:2633-2635. Detailed documentation source code can found website: https://www.maizegenetics.net/tassel

title: Getting Started with rTASSEL
text: read already existing R matrix, make sure formatted properly row column names. following example, make function simulate example R matrix values 0 1. properly formatted, read evaluate using readNumericGenotypeFromRMatrix() function:
code: # Simulate numeric matrices simNumericGt <- function(nRow, nCol) {     # Matrix values     minMax <- function(x) (x - min(x)) / (max(x) - min(x))     d <- rnorm(nCol * nRow) |> minMax()     m <- matrix(d, nrow = nRow, ncol = nCol)      # Taxa values     taxa <- sprintf("line_%02d", seq_len(nRow))      # Position values     mIds <- sprintf("marker_%02d", seq_len(nCol))     mPos <- seq_len(nCol)      # Add IDs to matrix     colnames(m) <- mIds     rownames(m) <- taxa      return(m) }  # Simulate a matrix with 5 taxa and 10 sites simMat <- simNumericGt(5, 10)  # Inspect the first 3 rows and columns simMat[1:3, 1:3] ##         marker_01 marker_02 marker_03 ## line_01 0.1997465 0.6905248 0.3627344 ## line_02 0.5185338 0.1185218 0.5904937 ## line_03 0.0000000 0.4217356 0.8670450 numGt <- readNumericGenotypeFromRMatrix(simMat)  numGt ## A TasselGenotypePhenotype Dataset ##   Class.............. TasselGenotypePhenotype  ##   Taxa............... 5  ##   Positions.......... 10  ##   Taxa x Positions... 50  ## --- ##   Genotype Table..... [x] ##   Phenotype Table.... [ ]

code: # Read in phenotype data phenoPathCov <- system.file("extdata", "mdp_phenotype.txt", package = "rTASSEL") tasPhenoCov <- readPhenotypeFromPath(phenoPathCov) ## The function 'readPhenotypeFromPath()' will be deprecated soon. ## This will be replaced by 'readPhenotype()' in the next update. # Calculate BLUEs tasBLUE <- assocModelFitter(     tasObj = tasPhenoCov,     formula = . ~ .,                  # <- All data is used!     fitMarkers = FALSE,     kinship = NULL,     fastAssociation = FALSE ) ## Association Analysis : BLUEs # Inspect results tasBLUE ## AssociationResults object with 2 reports and 3 mapped traits  ## Results: ##   * BLUE (284, 4)  ##   * BLUE_ANOVA (3, 9)  ## Traits: ##   * EarDia  ##   * EarHT  ##   * dpoll

code: # Calculate GLM tasGLM <- assocModelFitter(     tasObj = tasGenoPheno,          # <- our prior TASSEL object     formula = c(EarHT, dpoll) ~ .,  # <- only EarHT and dpoll are ran     fitMarkers = TRUE,              # <- set this to TRUE for GLM     kinship = NULL,     fastAssociation = FALSE ) ## Association Analysis : GLM # Inspect results tasGLM ## AssociationResults object with 2 reports and 2 mapped traits  ## Results: ##   * GLM_Stats (473, 18)  ##   * GLM_Genotypes (1144, 7)  ## Traits: ##   * EarHT  ##   * dpoll # Return association statistics tasGLM |> tableReport() |> head() ##   Trait      Marker Chr      Pos  marker_F            p marker_Rsq    add_F ## 1 EarHT  PZA00447.8   1  9024005 13.618030 0.0002749614 0.05165819 13.61803 ## 2 EarHT  PZB00718.1   1 17601375  7.781280 0.0005240456 0.05730746 15.11327 ## 3 EarHT  PZD00098.1   1 23267898 13.283879 0.0003234342 0.04878687 13.28388 ## 4 EarHT  PZA02921.4   1 25035053 13.188472 0.0003414352 0.04992069 13.18847 ## 5 EarHT PZA00654.12   1 32583282 12.812893 0.0004119944 0.04784271 12.81289 ## 6 EarHT  PZA00274.7   1 41505016  8.286272 0.0003240040 0.05949095 10.56148 ##          add_p    dom_F     dom_p marker_df marker_MS error_df error_MS ## 1 0.0002749614      NaN       NaN         1  5362.791      250 393.8008 ## 2 0.0001289429 0.479874 0.4891073         2  3029.927      256 389.3867 ## 3 0.0003234342      NaN       NaN         1  5217.500      259 392.7693 ## 4 0.0003414352      NaN       NaN         1  5169.563      251 391.9759 ## 5 0.0004119944      NaN       NaN         1  5093.203      255 397.5061 ## 6 0.0013050779 5.817597 0.0165545         2  3268.492      262 394.4466 ##   model_df model_MS minorObs ## 1        1 5362.791      124 ## 2        2 3029.927      105 ## 3        1 5217.500      108 ## 4        1 5169.563      101 ## 5        1 5093.203       16 ## 6        2 3268.492       55

code: # Calculate MLM tasMLM <- assocModelFitter(     tasObj = tasGenoPheno,             # <- our prior TASSEL object     formula = EarHT ~ .,               # <- run only EarHT     fitMarkers = TRUE,                 # <- set this to TRUE for GLM     kinship = tasKin,                  # <- our prior kinship object     fastAssociation = FALSE ) ## Association Analysis : MLM # Inspect results tasMLM ## AssociationResults object with 3 reports and 1 mapped traits  ## Results: ##   * MLM_Effects (7211, 7)  ##   * MLM_Stats (3094, 18)  ##   * MLM_Residuals_EarHT (279, 2)  ## Traits: ##   * EarHT

title: Getting Started with rTASSEL

code: # Read data - need only non missing data! phenoPathFast <-system.file(     "extdata",     "mdp_traits_nomissing.txt",     package = "rTASSEL" )  # Creat rTASSEL object - use prior TASSEL genotype object tasGenoPhenoFast <- readGenotypePhenotype(     genoPathOrObj = tasGenoHMP,     phenoPathDFOrObj = phenoPathFast ) ## The function 'readGenotypePhenotype()' will be deprecated soon. ## This will be replaced by 'join()' in the next update. # Calculate MLM tasFAST <- assocModelFitter(     tasObj = tasGenoPhenoFast,         # <- our prior TASSEL object     formula = . ~ .,                   # <- run all of the phenotype data     fitMarkers = TRUE,                 # <- set this to TRUE for GLM     kinship = NULL,     fastAssociation = TRUE             # <- set this to TRUE for fast assoc. ) ## Association Analysis : Fast Association # Inspect results tasFAST ## AssociationResults object with 1 reports and 3 mapped traits  ## Results: ##   * FastAssociation (640, 7)  ## Traits: ##   * dpoll  ##   * EarDia  ##   * EarHT

Genotypic phenotypic maize data consisting 279 samples, 3093 variant sites, 1 measured trait utilized analysis variant call format (VCF) import, generalized linear model (GLM) association, mixed linear model (MLM) association, kinship generation times (Flint-Garcia et al., 2005). illustrate effectiveness fast association method, 100 simulated RNA expression traits prior genotype data used. title: Installing rTASSEL
text: Since rTASSEL leverages TASSEL 5 Java API via rJava package, important allocate sufficient memory Java Virtual Machine (JVM) starts. done using options(java.parameters = "-Xmx...") command R, sets JVM parameters maximum heap size (e.g., -Xmx4g 4 GB). reason must set loading rTASSEL JVM can configured startup. initialized, memory settings changed without restarting R session. becomes especially important working large datasets computationally intensive method calls, can quickly exceed default memory allocation lead OutOfMemoryErrors. increasing available heap space proactively, ensure Java operations can performed efficiently without interruption due memory constraints. short, loading large genotype datasets /phenotype data, adamant specify memory allocated loading rTASSEL package via options() function:
code: # Allocate 4 GB of memory to the JVM options(java.parameters = "-Xmx4g")  # Load rTASSEL library(rTASSEL)

title: Installing rTASSEL
text: Certain instances RStudio Server computing clusters can override specify prior example (.e., running options() function loading rTASSEL) due JVM initialized options() function called recently initialized R session. JVM initialized, value provided java.parameters key options() call silently ignored. prevent happening, make sure set .Rprofile configuration file aforementioned options() call: Since setting .Rprofile configuration scope package, please refer Posit’s excellent write subject.

title: Installing rTASSEL
text: running OutOfMemory exceptions, verify specified enough memory via prior options() call. can help verify properly set enough memory startup. default, rJava allocate 500 MB (0.5 GB) memory session. time R session can report total memory allocated using couple rJava calls: java.parameters value options() set properly, value specified totMem value specify options().
code: # Call Java Runtime class runtime  <- rJava::.jcall("java/lang/Runtime", "Ljava/lang/Runtime;", "getRuntime")  # Get total memory allocation (reported in gigabytes [GB]) gbConv <- 1024^3 # e.g. ~1e9 (billion) bytes totMem <- round(round(rJava::.jcall(runtime, "J", "totalMemory") / gbConv, 3))  # Show in console totMem

title: R interface for TASSEL's association methods — assocModelFitter
text: tasObj object class TasselGenotypePenotype. formula R-based linear model formula. general layout formula uses following TASSEL data scheme: <data> ~ <factor> /<covariate>. traits Phenotype object ran, simplified formula (. ~ .) can used. scheme can also used running <data> <factor> /<covariate> data well. Single variables separated witha + operator. See vignette clarification. fitMarkers marker data fitted? TRUE, GLM analysis executed. FALSE, BLUEs calculated. Defaults FALSE. kinship kinship data accounted model? , TASSEL kinship matrix object class TasselDistanceMatrix must submitted. Defaults NULL. fastAssociation TASSEL's Fast Association plugin used? Consider setting TRUE many phenotypes data set. maxP Maximum p-value (0 - 1) reported. Currently works fast association . Defaults p-value 0.001 used threshold. Note: p-value parameter used BLUE analysis. maxThreads Maximum threads used running fast association. NULL, threads machine used. minClassSize minimum acceptable genotype class size. Genotypes class smaller size set missing. Defaults 0. outputFile Output file prefix specified case want write data directly disk. Highly recommended large datasets. NULL, data saved disk. character biallelicOnly test sites bi-allelic. alternative test sites two alleles. Defaults FALSE appendAddDom true, additive dominance effect estimates added stats report bi-allelic sites . effect estimated data source genotype (probability). additive effect always non-negative. Defaults FALSE.

title: rTASSEL 0.9.23
text: Specified function (kinshipMatrix() distanceMatrix()) now return object type TasselDistanceMatrix. Prevents console overload freezing seen large distance matrix objects. Now shows summary overview matrix instead Java object reference. Generic functions colnames(), rownames(), ncol(), nrow() return relative information similar operate matrix type objects. Primitive function .matrix() now supersedes deprecated functions kinshipToRMatrix() distanceToRMatrix(). Prior functions take kinship object now take new class. readTasselDistanceMatrix() Allows user read delimited distance matrix stored flat file. asTasselDistanceMatrix() Coerces pairwise matrix (e.g. m x m dimensions) column row names type matrix object type TasselDistanceMatrix. createTree() interface TASSEL’s tree creation methods Allows Neighbor_Joining UPGMA methods treeJavaApp() wrapper TASSEL’s interface Archaeopteryx Java tree Viewer Implements methods tree creation createTree()
